text: Hi everyone! I am trying to figure out how to add *optional* sections/modules to email templates (so that my client could choose to turn a specific section on or off when creating a new email). I found this info, but cannot seem to find anything on how to actually implement optional sections! <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Email-Marketing-Tool/Variable-Number-of-Modules-in-Email-Template/m-p/258191/highlight/false#M2666>Â (edited)
Hi Renessa, You can use a boolean field and wrap it around the optional section.

Hi <@U2H1Q3F8R> Thank you! I'm a designer/HubSpot beginner here. How/where does one create a boolean field? I guess I'm looking for beginner steps instructions on this! I wonder where documentation on this would be!

You will need some understanding of HTML and how HubSpot modules work in order to pull this off. I would recommend taking the HubSpot CMS course in the HubSpot academy. It will give you a good overview of the design capabilities within HubSpot.
<@U2H1Q3F8R> I do have good background on HTML, I'm just not sure of the logistics steps of this process here in HubSpot! I'll try to find this specific info in the course. Thanks!

create a module (make sure you check the email type when creating) . Add a field.  this will be the boolean.  Label it something identifiable such as toggle banner section.  you will have an option to copy the code from a drop down labeled *"action".*  within that, you should see an option "*Copy Snippet*" . Select that and you paste into the html editore pane.  now you should see an if statement and a comment saying add html here or something like that
bonus point for making all interior fields dependent on the boolean.
once you are happy with the module, copy module snippet and add to your email file
<@UD53A9UUR> This seems doable and helpful, thank you!!
